result.execSummary:
The defendant Lauren E Wade was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Lauren E Wade is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Lauren E Wade was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments]. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

8:37 AM Defendant Lauren E Wade appeared by video.  Attorney Mindy M. Nolan appeared by video for Lauren E Wade.  Prosecuting attorney Brooke L Erickson in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Victim M.G. appeared by video with his Atty Best. Court Reporter: Sara Rogan. Parties are prepared to proceed with plea/sentencing today. 

State indicates they are amending to Ct 2 to a DC ord and gives statement as to why. 
Victim gives statement on the record. 
Atty Best gives statement. 
State responds. 
Defense confirms this is how she thought the case was going to resolve today. 

Plea to amended Ct 1- NO CONTEST. 
BTC: Ct 1 GUILTY with Ct 2 being dismissed outright.
$200 fine+ Court Costs, payment plan $50/month beginning 12/1/22. 
Atty Best requests defendant's address be unsealed. 
Defense objects to address to be unsealed at this time. 
Atty Best responds. 
BTC: Atty Nolan to provide address to the victim.

Matter set for plea/sentencing. 
State requests another COP date for property to be transferred to RPD for victim to get them.
